definition: roundabout (traffic island)/around an island (trip etc)
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in
surname Huan
island/CL:個|个[ge4],座[zuo4]

sentences.english: Would you like to go cycling with me on the Road Around The Island on Saturday?
sentences.chinese: 星期六你願意和我一起去環島路騎自行車嗎？

sentences.english: A lot of people make sure that they visit it when they come here.
sentences.chinese: 很多來這裏遊玩的人都一定會去哥倫布環島。

sentences.english: and at that time Columbus Circle was very dirty.
sentences.chinese: 那時候，哥倫布環島這兒還很髒。

sentences.english: Bernie and his friends plan to do a road trip around the island after their graduation.
sentences.chinese: 柏尼和他的朋友計畫畢業後環島旅行。

sentences.english: Parkview room decorated around the island model drawings.
sentences.chinese: 環島麗園樣板房裝飾施工圖。

sentences.english: "Did you know, " the cop says, "that at the last traffic roundabout, your wife fell out of the car?"
sentences.chinese: 你知道你妻子在前面的環島從車上掉下來了嗎？

sentences.english: What do you think of the big statue in Columbus Circle?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得哥倫布環島上的那尊雕像怎麼樣？

sentences.english: There's one right up on Columbus right there.
sentences.chinese: 哥倫布環島那兒就有一家。

sentences.english: We are considering taking a trip around the island.
So that's what I can tell you about Columbus Circle.
sentences.chinese: 那就是我能告訴你的關於哥倫布環島的信息。

sentences.english: Trains sin and out of the island as well as island-looping high-speed trains have all halted services.
sentences.chinese: 進出海南島的火車以及環島高鐵都已經停止運行了。

sentences.english: We happy to set foot on the island that extended upward path.
sentences.chinese: 大家歡快地踏上了那條向高處延伸的環島路。

sentences.english: Can you tell us about Columbus Circle?
sentences.chinese: 你能跟我們講講哥倫布環島嗎？

sentences.english: After that, some of my classmates went to fish and others went to travel round the island in a boat.
sentences.chinese: 在那之後，我的一些同學去去旅行環島在船上釣魚。

sentences.english: Do you have any personal experience with Columbus Circle?
sentences.chinese: 在哥倫布環島，你有什麼個人經歷嗎？

definition: to ride (a bicycle, horse, motorbike etc)/cycling/horseback riding/motorbike riding/a ride/CL:次[ci4]
Kenting, a national park on the southern tip of Taiwan, popular as a tourist destination (abbr. for 墾丁國家公園|垦丁国家公园[Ken3 ding1 Guo2 jia1 Gong1 yuan2])
Hualien, city and county on the east coast of Taiwan
to cycle
to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
Xiamen or Amoy, subprovincial city in Fujian, abbr. 廈|厦[Xia4]
Taidong or Taitung city and county in Taiwan
lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information
bicycle/bike (Tw)/CL:輛|辆[liang4]
to tour/sightseeing/tourism
to dawdle/to go slow deliberately/to fizzle out/to have all one's hopes dashed/(Tw) to have a soak in a hot spring
scenic spot/place of interest (tourism)
locomotive/train engine car/scooter (Tw)/(slang) (Tw) hard to get along with/a pain in the ass/damn!/crap!
coast/seaside/seashore/beach
to go abroad/to leave the country/emigration
on the way
